pullRequest.title: [Feature] Side-by-side view for plagiarism inspection (Modeling Exercises)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I added screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
For motivation and context, check out #2100.
Description
I added the ArtemisPlagiarismModule under exercises/shared which exports the PlagiarismInspectorComponent.
To implement the PlagiarismSplitViewComponent, I added the split.js library.
Steps for Testing

Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration > Your Course > Exercises
Create a modeling exercise
Use multiple accounts to create similar submissions for your modeling exercise
Go to the exercise details page
Click 'Check plagiarism'

You should now be redirected to a new page with the plagiarism inspector. Check the following functionality:

Given similar submissions exist, clicking on 'Check Plagiarism' should fetch detected plagiarisms and display them in the sidebar on the left
Detected plagiarisms are sorted by their similarity in descending order
Selecting a plagiarism item in the sidebar loads the related submissions and displays them in the split view
The split view should be resizable
Split view shortcuts should work (top right)
Confirming/Denying a plagiarism should update its status indicator in the sidebar
Downloading the results should include a 'confirmed' column/attribute if the plagiarism was confirmed/denied (both JSON and CSV)

Screenshots

commit.message: Add plagiarism module and plagiarism-inspector component
Add split controls to plagiarism-header component
Move checkPlagiarism() functionality to plagiarism inspector
Add modeling editor to plagiarism split view
Add functionality to tag a plagiarism; add split pane headers
Add warning message to plagiarism header
Sort plagiarisms in descending order by similarity
Add student logins to plagiarism item

nodes.bodyText: You can just use the routerLink directive here. If you are not using it on an ancheor tag, it will automatically bound to the clickEvent of the element. This saves you a method call
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -37,16 +37,10 @@

Modeling Exerc   Edit -
- -
- - -
-
+

nodes.bodyText: Remove and do it via the routerLink directive as explained in the other comment :)
Why can this be undefined? Would it not make sense that it is always either true or false?
the naming does not really make sense for a boolean? You are not emitting the tag
You do not need a method for this. Just use the routerLink directive :)
Should this not be named something like isPlagiarismCheckInProgress?

You do not need to unsubscribe to http subscriptions as far as i know.
https://medium.com/@lukaonik/do-we-need-to-unsubscribe-http-client-in-angular-86d781522b99

commit.message: Make use of the routerLink directive to navigate to and from the PlagiarismInspectorComponent
Update the name of the loading flag in PlagiarismInspectorComponent

nodes.bodyText: Build is failing I think because of this.
